did.unittitle: Sophonisba Angusciola Peale Sellers account books, 1834-1845
did.abstract: The first volume is accounts with her sons, Charles and George Escol Sellers, of sums given her by them (1834-1836). The second volume is a receipt book, containing receipts for payment of taxes, ground rents, groceries, and interest, as administratrix of the estate of Coleman Sellers (1834-1845). The third volume is a record of expenses while keeping house for her son-in-law Alfred Harrold, including wages, carriage fares, "childrens board," and groceries (1840-1845).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Presented by Charles Coleman Seller and accessioned, 1945. See in-house shelf list for additional accession numbers.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Sophonisba Angusciola Peale Sellers was a daughter of Charles Willson Peale.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.

odd.head: Early American History Not
odd.p: These three slim volumes contain a range of personal financial records for Sophonisba Sellers, the daughter of Charles Wilson Peale. The third volume (#47) includes what appears to be a daily shopping record of Sophonisba.
